Patients suffer as West Bengal doctors\u.description: LUCKNOW: From tying black bands to attending patients with helmets on, junior doctors in Uttar Pradesh tried their best to express solidarity with their colleagues in West Bengal who are protesting against attacks on them. “We wore bandages to show that we are humans too. Despite best efforts, saving a life on every occasion is not possible,” said Dr Anil Gangwar, national convenor, Resident Doctors Association at Sanjay Gandhi Postgraduate Institute of Medical Sciences. Wearing bandages, the medicos went around the OPD area to garner public support for the aggrieved doctors in West Bengal. Inside the wards, junior doctors wore black bands as a mark of protest against the West Bengal government for its failure to act against those who attacked junior doctors at NRS Medical College and Hospital (NRSMCH) in Kolkata. In Kanpur, resident doctors at Ganesh Shankar Vidyarthi Medical College wore helmets while attending to their patients. “You never know when an angry attendant will hit you,” justified a second year student. Similar protests were reported from various medical colleges in the state. Resident doctors at the Institute of Medical Sciences-Banaras Hindu University went on a day-long strike to support their colleagues. Patients had a harrowing time as outdoor services were hit in the first half. Condemning the violence in West Bengal, junior doctors in Swaroop Rani Nehru Hospital of Allahabad Medical College boycotted work for some hours, causing inconvenience to patients. Residents in KGMU also gathered outside the administrative building to demand justice for their fellows in NRSMCH. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shayari or short film? Pick an app to ma.description: Lucknow: If you have forgotten to buy a gift for Father’s Day, your phone could help you out. Various mobile applications on Google and Apple iOS and a dozen Facebook and Instagram features will have you sorted for sending an extra special wish to your father on June 16. From thoughtful messages in your chosen language to virtual photo frames and animated stickers/gifs and video tutorials for customised cards, these applications are at the service of every tech-savvy kid who wants to send a warm Father’s Day wish with great meaning. If you are at a loss of words but want to tell your dad how much he means to you, then the app ‘Father’s Day Shayari 2019’ on Google Play store is your go-to place. The app has beautiful poems and couplets in Hindi and other languages that you can send through a text or WhatsApp message. The best feature is you can also record and submit a shayari in your own voice. An app by Digital Flames on HD wallpapers, quotes, and images, is among the favourite of users. Frames app, which provides instant frames to pictures, is trending on iOS store. If you want to design your own card, then ‘Fathers Day Card Creator’ and ‘Little Box of Ideas’ provides you an opportunity to pick your own background, add stickers, write a text and email it. You can also share it on Facebook and Twitter. For quirky face stickers for your father, the Facemoji app on Play store is your option. Facebook camera and Messenger each has frames you can superimpose with your images. Instagram has added gifs such as #1DAD, Best Dad Ever, among others, that you can share on your Instagram story. Google Photos has rolled out a feature where you can make a short video clip with your stored pictures. Apple is offering a similar feature. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Toppers bet on clear concepts & revision.description: LUCKNOW: Computer science remains the favourite stream of engineering aspirants and their dream destination to study it is the Indian Institute of Technology. City high-scorers of the Joint Entrance Examination (Advanced), the results of which were announced on Friday, aspire to get admission to the coveted IITs to fulfil a dream they have worked relentlessly for, for the past year or more. With the results, a gateway for admission to top engineering institutions, now set to decide what college they get, most students share that their aim is to become the best computer engineer in the country. Scoring all India rank (AIR) 1,113, Prajit Kumar said, "I will make it to an IIT easily but my only wish is to pursue computer science engineering from IIT Bombay. It is not only because of the salary package it will offer but also to use my knowledge for making my nation a digital one." Kumar scored 205 marks of 360 in the examination.  "I am very happy with my result. It was my second attempt. From the 15,000th rank in the first attempt, I have made it to close to 1,000. Self-study with regular breaks helped me improve my score," he added. Kumar advises that one should not rush through topics in a hurry to cover the entire syllabus without focusing on fundamentals. Studying round-the-clock is not important, but it should be ensured that whatever one studies makes concepts clear, he added. Prasoon Bajpai, who secured 1,173rd rank, said he wants to be a computer engineer so that he can fix technical snags that give a tough time to students during results. "Technology is something that eases life and reduces stress. I want to develop a software that helps in fixing technical snags, especially like the one which had hit JEE (Advanced) results today," he said. Scoring 1,282nd rank,Anudeep Verma said he aspires to study in IIT Bombay for computer science. "Every developing nation needs to be good at technology and I want to contribute to this," he said. For Kanishk Gandhi, who secured 1,711th rank, it was sticky notes of important concepts stuck to his desk which helped him revise concepts daily. "The only success mantra is to have basic concepts clear and daily revision. I want to pursue aerodynamics from IIT-Delhi and contribute to research in the field," said Kanishk. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP: Youth throws acid on girlfriend\u201.description: LUCKNOW: Angry over his girlfriend’s marriage getting fixed with another youth, a man allegedly threw acid on the girl’s would-be husband and mother-inlaw at their home in Huzurpur area of Bahraich. The victims, Harinam, 25, and his mother Anita (48), who suffered minor burns are recuperating at a government hospital, police said. The accused, who is yet to be identified, is on the run. SHO Huzurpur Manoj Kumar Rai told TOI: “Around 9.30pm on Saturday, a youth scaled the boundary wall of Harinam’s home and threw acid over Anita and then on Harinam. As victims were asleep, they could not react immediately. The attacker soon fled the spot.” Some neighbours tried to chase the attacker but in vain. SP Bahraich Gaurav Grover said an FIR on the charges of causing hurt by weapons has been registered against an unidentified person. Preliminary probe has revealed that Harinam’s marriage was fixed with a village girl last week, Grover said, adding that apparently that girl was in a relationship with a youth from another village. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sikh beaten in Delhi.description: NEW DELHI: There was high drama in north Delhi's Mukherjee Nagar on Sunday evening when a group of policemen clashed with a Gramin Sewa driver and his son, a minor. The incident was captured by passersby on mobile phone and the footage went viral. In the video, a few policemen were seen hitting the driver with sticks and then kicking him. The man was later detained. However, Delhi Police, in a statement, claimed that the incident took place after the driver hit a police van and started arguing with cops. Things took a turn for the worse as the driver then allegedly pulled out a sword and assaulted an on-duty officer. While trying to escape from the spot, the accused hit another cop with his vehicle, police said. Later, the policemen chased the vehicle and forced the driver to stop. The juvenile son of the driver also joined the argument, they said. In another video of the incident, the driver was seen arguing with a cop while holding a sword. An inquiry has been initiated into the incident. Meanwhile, five people, including two women, were arrested for assaulting cops who tried to intervene in a fight near Tibia college in central Delhi. The incident happened on Friday evening. CCTV footage was being checked to ascertain the exact sequence of events, police said. In Video:On cam: Sikh driver, his son beaten, dragged and kicked on road by Delhi PoliceDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

"Another strike on Pakistan by team India and the result is the same. Congratulations to the entire team for this superb performance. Every Indian is feeling proud and celebrating this impressive win," Shah said in a tweet. Another strike on Pakistan by #TeamIndia and the result is same. Leaders cutting across party lines wished team India for its performance in what was seen as a prestige battle. Defence minister Rajnath Singh said, "Congratulations to Indian cricket team for winning the match against Pakistan in the CWC 2019. I wish our men in blue all the luck in their march towards the coveted World Cup." We hope that you will bring honour to the country by winning the World Cup. We are proud of Team India," he tweeted in Hindi. Lucknow University over the moon as 1997.description: LUCKNOW: When Lucknow girl Ritu Karidhal Srivastava was announced as the mission director for Chandrayaan-2 — India’s second mission to the moon — her alma mater became a venue of joyful celebrations. Ritu, who is born and brought up in Lucknow’s Rajajipuram, did her schooling from Navyug Kanya Vidyalaya and pursued her higher education from Lucknow University (LU). When the news about Ritu’s rare feat broke in her alma mater, LU teachers were elated with joy. They called each other to inform the milestone achieved by Ritu. The news of the former student, who graduated, postgraduated, got enrolled in a doctorate course from physics department and later taught at the same department, made the entire faculty proud. “It’s a moment of pride for us as the meritorious girl has made a mark in the rocket science. I had taught her in MSc and after completing her PG in 1997, she got enrolled in PhD under me,” said Prof Manisha Gupta, faculty, physics department. She said, “Ritu was my scholar for just six months and left the university after clearing the Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) and later joined IISc, Bangalore, to pursue a masters in aerospace engineering... She was different, a very simple student who never boasted that she was a high scorer and has an extraordinary scientific knowledge during classroom teaching.” Physics department head Prof Poonam Tandon said, “It feels so proud that our students have not only touched the sky but have reached far beyond in space. As the news broke, all faculty members who taught her in graduation and postgraduation celebrated the achievement.” Popularly known as the ‘rocket woman’ of India, Ritu, a scientist with the Indian Space Research Organisation (Isro), has served as a deputy operations director to India’s Mars Mission or Mangalyaan and will now spearhead the next space mission Chandrayaan-2. Chandrayaan-2 is country's ambitious moon mission in continuation with Chandrayan-1. Chandrayaan-2 is scheduled to be launched at 2.51am on July 15. The moon landing is expected on September 6 or 7. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. 700 UG medical seats added to Uttar Prad.description: LUCKNOW: As many as 700 medical seats would be added to the state’s kitty of 1,990 seats. Admissions against these seats would begin from the current session. Listing out the additional seats as one of the BJP government’s achievements on Thursday, medical education minister Ashutosh Tandon said, “This is a record in its own way.” The seats have come up in the state medical education institute in Noida, state medical college in Badaun and autonomous state medical colleges in Basti, Bahraich, Ayodhya, Shahjahanpur and Firozabad. Principal secretary medical education Rajneesh Dubey said that there was a proposal to add another 300 seats under the EWS quota. He also informed that efforts were on to add the number postgraduate medical seats in the state. “At present, there are 870 PG seats across UP, a proposal for 640 more seats has been sent to the Medical Council of India. If all goes as per plan, the seats would be added from the next academic session,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lucknow: Stray bull attacks, injures cor.description: LUCKNOW: The failure of Lucknow Municipal Corporation (LMC) in tackling the stray cattle menace in the city despite 14 attacks being reported in last two months led to one of its own members — corporator of Geetapalli ward Arvind Yadav — becoming a victim and sustaining injuries when a bull chased and assaulted him on Friday night. As many as three persons have died and 24 injured in attacks by stray cattle in the state capital in last two months. Besides, nine members of LMC cattle catching squad have also been injured while trying to catch strays during drives. Arvind’s relatives told TOI that he had gone to talk to the junior engineer of Jal Sansthan regarding low water pressure in his area. While he was on his way back to home, a stray bull chased him and pinned him down on the road. The locals at the spot rushed to save Yadav and took him to a nearby hospital. When TOI visited Geetapalli ward on Saturday, local resident Anchal Praveen, said, “We all are living in a state of fear as these stray animals are everywhere, but the civic and administration officials are just sitting in their offices and not doing anything.” LMC officials said there were around 4,000 stray bulls in the city of which 2,000 have been caught in the past month. Besides, there are 3,500 stray cows on the streets. “We have conducted one drive against strays in the area and will launch another soon. Some of our staff members sustained injuries while catching cattle, hence our drive lost the steam and was hit,” said LMC chief veterinary officer Arvind Rao. Lucknow: MNC job ad in paper fools law s.description: LUCKNOW: A 30-year-old aspiring lawyer was duped into paying Rs 11 lakh to a man who promised him a job with an MNC headquartered in the US. Rajeev Dubey, a native of Farrukhabad district and pursuing an LLB degree from a private college in Chinhat, lodged an FIR on Friday against one Saurabh Singh who had posted an advertisement for law graduates in a vernacular daily. “I saw the ad in February. The job with the MNC’s India operations promised Rs 22,500 a month. I called a number mentioned in the ad. Saurabh Singh received the call and convinced me I was eligible. He promised an offer by March,” Dubey, who lives on rent in Vrindavan Yojana, told police. However, Singh allegedly demanded Rs 11 lakh to facilitate the appointment. “I paid the money in instalments between March and June 10. The advertiser said the offer letter would directly come from the US. It never did.” When Dubey called Singh, asking him to return the money, the latter allegedly threatened him with dire consequences. In-charge, nodal cyber cell, Abhay Mishra said efforts were on to track down Singh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lucknow: Children fit fitness into their.description: The first day of powerpacked Happy Streets not only attracted Lucknowites to reclaim their streets but also served a special purpose! The venue saw father-kid duo’s spending a quality time with each other on Father’s Day on Sunday. A large number of fathers were seen celebrating the day with their kids while peddling down the road. Manik Anand participated in a bicycle race with his teenage daughter Saanvi. “Though my father cheated during the race, I didn’t complain because today is his day. That is why I let him win... He is too busy during week days. Happy Streets also gave me a chance to fit fitnesses into his lifestyle,” said Saanvi. Five-year-old Ayyan was a happy lot on Sunday. He always wanted to learn to ride a bicycle with his father, but couldn’t do so due to his busy schedule. With an array of activities, he not only enjoyed the event but also fulfilled his wish of learning the ride with his father. “He always stayed busy round the clock. It was difficult for him even on Sundays to take out time from his hectic schedule. Today, he came around with me and not only played games, but also danced with me during the fitness session,” said Ayyan. Echoing similar sentiments was Madhu Mishra, who attended Happy Streets for the first time with her father. “Social media has taken a toll on us because of which we are spending less time interacting with our parents. Happy Streets encourages us to step out of our home with our parents. Since today is a day dedicated to the fathers, I couldn't think of a better Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lucknow: BJP sets eyes on Jatav, Yadav v.description: LUCKNOW: While the Samajwadi Party and BSP are still to recover from the shock of the humiliating defeat at the hands of the BJP in the recently-concluded general elections, the BJP -- in a bid to weaken the regional parties further – will begin a membership drive with main focus on Yadavs and Jatavs. In their first meeting following the parliamentary elections held on Sunday, the BJP decided to make a concerted effort to win over the traditional votebank of the two regional parties. The fresh membership drive will begin from July 6, birth anniversary of founding president of Jan Sangh -- rechristened in 1980 as BJP -- Shyama Prasad Mukherjee. Party vice-president JPS Rathore has been made in-charge of the drive that will conclude on August 10. One of the vice-presidents of the party told TOI that though BJP had won 312 Assembly seats in 2017, the 2019 Lok Sabha election saw the lead of the party coming down to 284, despite registering overall increase in vote share in 385 Assembly seats. The BJP leadership, while deliberating at length on the success of the party in the Lok Sabha elections, emphasised that the membership drive should have focus on members of Jatav and Yadav communities who voted in less number for the BJP as compared to other social sections. Raqabganj, Lalbagh inch closer to acute.description: LUCKNOW: The rate of groundwater depletion in the city has doubled in six years — from 45-50cm a year till 2013 to a metre at present — owing to indiscriminate extraction for both domestic and commercial use, a latest survey by Jal Sansthan has revealed. The report covering eight prominent residential areas shows rapid depletion in the past three years with the maximum plunge in Gomtinagar, Indiranagar, Jail Road, Lalbagh and Raqabganj. Jal Sansthan had to rebore 32 tubewells in these areas to maintain water supply. “We carry out a survey every three years. In 2013, groundwater was available at 5.5-6 metres below surface, which in 2016 dropped to 7-9 metres below surface. The latest report shows groundwater availability 10-12 metres below surface. In six years, the water level has gone down by six metres. In other words, water is now available at twice the depth it was in 2013,” said a senior official. The reason behind the depletion, say experts, has been indiscriminate extraction of groundwater through tubewells and submersible pumps for domestic and commercial purposes. In 2013, the city had 520 government tubewells to supply drinking water in 112 localities. Today, there are 775 supplying water to 175 areas, courtesy rising demand owing to an increase in population. In 2013, tubewells were extracting 300 million litres of water every day, which has now increased to 450 million litres. Besides, hundreds of submersible pumps have been installed by people for personal and commercial uses. There is no account of the quantity of water being drawn by these pumps, sources said. Convener of Water Action Group RS Sinha said the government needed to take urgent steps to recharge groundwater through rainwater harvesting and harness surface water for public use. Jal Sansthan general manager SK Verma said the report had been submitted to the district authorities for remedial measures. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

In day-long drive, Lucknow traffic polic.description: LUCKNOW: The proverbial long arm of the law stretched from Charbagh to Polytechnic intersection and beyond to book as many as 305 policemen, including 155 traffic monitors, on Friday in an unprecedented crackdown on road rule offenders in the city in recent times. Most of these men and women in uniform were of constable and sub-inspector ranks, and all were prosecuted for riding two-wheelers without helmets. The daylong drive from 10am also penalised another 3,117 motorists and bikers for various traffic violations. “Policemen should lead by example. Hence, we decided to conduct the drive also at Police Lines, where many were caught without helmets,” said Lucknow SSP Kalanidhi Naithani who monitored the crackdown launched on the instructions of state police chief OP Singh. “It will be a sustained drive,” Naithani added. On Day One, a total of Rs 1.38 lakh was collected as fines. “During the first few days, we will focus on people riding two-wheelers without helmets. Next, motorists without seat belts will be brought to book,” said ASP (traffic) Purnendu Singh. The crackdown team also came across 574 vehicles that were repeat offenders, having violated traffic rules four times or more. “We have initiated the process to suspend registration of such vehicles,” said ASP Singh. Singh further said that they had identified several areas in the city were commuters would not be allowed to enter without a helmet, one such route being the stretch between 1090 intersection and Bandariya Bagh. “We are also planning to ban entry of bikers/scooterists without helmets at multilevel parking lots, malls and banks, among other places. Our quick response units will monitor these facilities from Monday,” the ASP added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Uttar Pradesh fails to meet wheat purcha.description: LUCKNOW: The Uttar Pradesh government may have set a target of purchasing 55 lakh metric tonne (MT) of wheat from farmers at minimum support price (MSP) during the kharif season from March to May, it has been able to procure only about 36 lakh MT till now. With nearly 20 lakh MT still left to be purchased, the deadline, which ended on May 31, has been extended to end-June, as sowing of paddy has already begun. State agriculture minister Surya Pratap Shahi told TOI that the purchase targets may have been affected as government staff were deployed in election duty. “Another reason could be that wheat-growers may have found the prices in the open market more lucrative,” said Shahi. Chief minister Yogi Adityanath has been reviewing wheat purchase and has often asked food department officials to ensure that purchase centres are functional and farmers do not face any hardship in selling their produce to the government. This year, the state agriculture department had enhanced the MSP of wheat to Rs 1,840 per quintal, and had even added an incentive of Rs 20 per quintal for transportation, to provide relief to distressed farmers. However, despite the CM’s insistence on making processes easy and raising of MSP, the purchase has fallen below target. Estimates by government say the total purchase may not cross even 40 lakh MT. Agriculture department officials, told TOI on condition of anonymity that since wheat production in the state was low this time season as compared to the previous year, there could be an increase in wheat prices in the market. Shahi, however, denied this claim. “The estimated production of wheat in the state was nearly 380 lakh MT while last year it was nearly 356 lakh MT. Not only production, even productivity has risen this year, from 36.56 quintal to 37.58 quintal per hectare,” said Shahi. “Lower sale by farmers at government purchase centres is an indication of farmers getting better prices at their farms itself,” said food and civil supplies commissioner Alok Kumar. “This is the purpose of the state government in fixing MSP for farmers. We provide MSP to farmers so that they are not exploited by traders in the open market and they sell their produce to the government at better prices. If they are not selling their produce to government agencies at MSP, it means they are getting better and remunerative prices in open market. This is the aim of the government -- that farmers should get better price,” said Kumar. “There has been an increase in demand for wheat from southern states this year. And, the market price of wheat has also increased in equal proportion. So, failing to meet purchase target is not a matter of concern,” added Kumar. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

How the Lucknow Municipal Corporation se.description: LUCKNOW: The Lucknow Municipal Corporation (LMC) has spent Rs 50 lakh to clean drains before monsoon, but its workers have left behind mounds of silt and sludge, which are likely to make their way back to where they were once the rains begin by the end of this month. Clogged drains may flood parts of the city and defeat the purpose with which the LMC is using taxpayers’ money. The city has an 1,800km network of small drains, besides 26 big nullahs. A budget of Rs 1.5 crore has been allocated to clean these drains twice a year — before and after monsoon. A TOI reality check revealed that the LMC will not be able to meet the June 15 deadline set by the Lucknow bench of Allahabad high court, as 35% of drains remain unattended till date. Additional municipal commissioner Amit Singh conceded that around Rs 50 lakh had been spent to clean 65% of the drain network. “Private agencies have been roped in for the task. We will probe if workers are doing a shoddy job. Strict action will be taken against negligent agencies,” he added. The silt and sludge are not only threatening to flow back into drains, but also inconveniencing residents. In Mahanagar, Sector C resident Sushil Prajapati said the mounds were blocking the pavement in front of his house. “How are people supposed to walk? Many are risking life and limb to use the carriageway instead of the footpath,” he said. Rajendra Gupta of Alamgarh also voiced his displeasure. “The sludge was left behind for five days. Most of it has now gone back into the drain. The area is kicking up a stink, which is unbearable,” he said. At Nishatganj, Manoj Sinha complained that the filth everywhere was breeding mosquitoes. “You know who and what to blame if there’s a disease outbreak here,” Sinha said. Bhupendra Asthana, a resident of Ashiana, said the sludge was all over the road, thanks to stray animals. “Only the LMC knows how to send lakhs of rupees down the drain,” he said. (With inputs from Shambhavi Misra, Aditya Shukla, Juhi Bhargava and Anshika Mehrotra) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Hindi, Sanskrit UG seats at Lucknow Univ.description: LUCKNOW: Though the state capital is included with prominence in what experts call the ‘Hindi heartland’, there are few takers for the language as well as Sanskrit from which it is said to have been derived. Both Hindi and Sanskrit failed to attract candidates seeking admission in undergraduate course of Lucknow University and most seats are vacant. Hindi failed in its heartland with students taking no interest in learning the national language. Among the 39 subject combinations offered by LU in BA, maximum seats are vacant in Hindi and 50% seats are vacant in functional Hindi. There are 400 seats of Hindi in BA but as many as 108 are vacant while only 15 of 30 seats in functional Hindi have been filled. Similarly, not many were inclined to learn Sanskrit as 35 of 80 seats in the subject and all 30 seats in functional Sanskrit remaining vacant. The fate of Persian is no better with not a single candidate applying for even one of the 60 seats. Likewise, only 5 seats of the 60 seats in Arabic have been filled. “The fall in popularity of Hindi and Sanskrit at higher education level is because of poor quality of education imparted at school level where students are not encouraged to study these subjects,” said Prof Ravikant of Hindi department. He said that though students are running towards professional courses, it’s the failure on part of teachers and academic institutions who fail to generate interest of students in literature and languages. More than 50% seats are vacant in Urdu and French as well. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lucknow: Duo cloned cards in garb of ser.description: LUCKNOW: Two cyber criminals stealing money through card cloning were arrested in Azamgarh on Saturday. The duo was identified as Suraj Yadav, 25, and Sujeet Yadav, 28. Suraj and Sujeet ran a common service center, which helps in getting e-service of government.  They targeted people who visited their centre and made payment through their cards. The accused had bought a card reader and skimmer from online shopping websites to commit the crime. “Customers visiting to get the government’s service were targeted and their cards were cloned. They got access to their ATM pin by recording their password by installing a secret camera,” said SP Azamgarh Triveni Singh. First the accused used to copy card data on blank cards. Cloned cards were then sent to cities like Mumbai and Pune from where money was withdrawn. Card cloners used to get 25 % commission of the total amount withdrawn, said the officer. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

PM writes to village heads in UP, urges.description: LUCKNOW: Suresh Kumar, head of ramtola village in Sonbhadra, was supervising work at his fields on Saturday evening when he got a call from his father. “You have got a letter from the PM,” informed the excited elderly. Suresh rushed back home to find out the contents. “One is bound to feel proud on receiving the PM’s letter,” remarked the village head. Quickly reading the content, Suresh said: “he (PM) has emphasised on the importance of water conservation and rain water harvesting.” Agreeing with the need to save water head of Kaancha village, Mohd Kuddoos said: “People listened to PM’s mann ki baat but forgot about it later. The letter will be a constant reminder of his teachings.” The letter from PM urges the pradhans to undertake every possible effort to save water. “The rainy season is round the corner… we are lucky that India gets enough rain and it is our duty to conserve this gift of god,” the letter read. Adding that efforts must be made to save rain water as far as possible, the PM further wrote: “Let us get trenches made around the fields, build check dams and dikes, take up cleaning and rejuvenation of ponds, construct tankaas (underground water storage tanks) and ensure zero wastage of the rain water.” Officials in the state rural development informed that the letter is being sent to over 97,000 heads in 75 districts of UP. To note, ground water situation in the state is dismal. As per state government data 217 blocks across 22 districts belong to over exploited (critical) and semi-critical categories. NITI Aayog’s Composite Water Management Index Report 2018 also expressed concern over the situation in UP. Stated that the groundwater crisis in UP is progressively worsening, the report attributed the problem to factors like unplanned urbanisation, unabated boring, rampant exploitation of groundwater and surface water by government and private bodies, failure to replenish it through rainwater harvesting and lack of awareness among people among other things. It pointed out that the state has a gross withdrawal of about 5.28 million hectares, among the highest in India. Experts welcomed the move hoping that it would get its due importance. “Community led initiatives are more sustainable,” said Farrukh R Khan of Wateraid, a not for profit organisation that works for the water related issues. Technical expert in hydrogeology and former scientist at the state ground water department, RS Sinha said that the letter provides an opportunity to address the issue but warned against the rat-race that may follow in the bid to attract the PM’s attention. “It is been over 15 years since the issue of groundwater was identified. A number of success stories can be heard but many things are taking place in pockets. Stakeholder departments must ensure that a micro-planning is undertaken before people join the bandwagon,” he said. He informed that there were demand and supply aspects to water conservation – be it on the ground or beneath it. “Strategies listed out by the PM speak about the paradigm of supply. Strategies change from place to place. Steps must be taken to reduce the demand to check wastage and ensure optimum utilisation of available water,” he explained. Experts also underscored the need to implement available rules for rain water harvesting in urban areas. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kabhi aisi naubat hi nahi aayi ki main #.description: Singer Shaan who visited the city recently, said he loves the connection Lucknow shares with history. "I’ve been to Lucknow quite a few times and jab bhi aaya hoon kaafi ghooma hoon. But it was a long time ago that I explored the city properly. I remember wandering about in Bhool Bhulaiyya, Bada Imambara, Ghanta Ghar and all the historic places in Lucknow. And Lucknow is also known for its avid connection to history," said the 'Chaand Sifarish' singer. Further appreciating the quality of food Lucknow serves, the singer said, "Of course, wahan ke kebabs and wahan ka khana is wonderful. Be it Tunday or be it Dastarkhwan, the food has always been amazing." Besides food and culture, Shaan also loved the crowd whenever he has performed in Lucknow. "I’ve performed in the Lucknow Mahotsav more than once, and I always had a wonderful experience performing here in the city. The crowd of Lucknow is very energetic and enthusiastic. The best thing about the Lucknow Mahotsav was the organised crowd and the disciplined people," said Shaan. Shaan, who is known for songs like 'Hey Shona' and 'All Is Well', doesn’t believe in discussing political issues and loves to remain politically neutral. "I don’t have any political opinion or views. I’d rather have social views. Jo hum political discussions karte hain usse better hai ki hum social discussions karein. Everyone can bring a change at some level, without relying on political support or alliance. We should leave the politics to the politicians. I myself work on social issues through my music. I have composed a song on air pollution among other social issue based songs. I am also doing a campaign on cancer awareness. So I think we should prioritize social issues over political issues," believes Shaan.  Shaan (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) Not having heard of the #Mentoo movement yet, the singer believes that it is justified, "I actually wasn’t aware of the #Mentoo movement. Kabhi aisi naubat aayi hi nahi ki main #Metoo controversy mein phansu. So kabhi #Mentoo ke baare me socha nahi." Further speaking about the movement, he said, “I think it’s justified because if you accuse someone of anything and if it includes an accusation on their character, then it is a big thing and usse nikalna bahot mushkil hota hai. And in some cases, where the allegations are wrong then zindagi bhar ke liye dhabba lag jata hai. However, this #Mentoo movement, where a male can raise his voice against wrong allegations, I think it is a good move. Unhe yeh liberty milni chahiye." The singer also is in support of the #Metoo movement and says it was a good step in the industry, “The #Metoo movement was necessary because people who were in power took things for granted. They thought ke haan hum kuchh bhi kar sakte hain and humein koi nahi rok sakta. So I think the inception of the #Metoo movement was also a good step." Shaan is seen working in less Bollywood projects currently. He is spending more time in other things including travelling and learning guitar. "I am a singer and I love to sing songs, doesn’t matter if it is in a Bollywood movie or not. When I was singing for Bollywood and was into playback singing, I didn’t have time to do many other things like composing a song. Now what is happening is ke main workout ka bhi mazaa le raha hoon, vacations kar raha hoon, guitar sikh raha hoon. So mujhe bahot zyada waqt mil raha hai to do other things. And saath-saath I’m singing songs too, it’s just not too much Bollywood songs," said Shaan. — Saad Abbasi Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Seven-year-old girl raped, killed by fat.description: GORAKHPUR: A seven-year-old girl was allegedly raped and killed by her father's acquaintance here following which he was arrested on Saturday, police said. On Friday, Vinod Rai, 55, saw the girl and her 12-year-old sister playing in their house, senior superintendent of police (SSP) Sunil Gupta said. He told them that their father was calling them and the older girl sent her sister with him, Gupta said. On Friday night, the Sikriganj Police was informed via the Dial-100 helpline that the girl had been abducted by Rai on a motorcycle, the official said. The police arrested him and during interrogation he told them that he had dumped the girl's body in a mango orchard in his village. Her body was recovered by the police, they said. Rai was booked on charges of kidnapping, rape, murder and under the POCSO (Protection of Children from Sexual Offences) Act, the SSP said. He has three children, including two daughter who are married. He was alone at home on the day of the incident as his wife and 19-year-old son were on a visit to Mumbai, the official said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Akhilesh meets Governor Ram Naik over la.description: LUCKNOW: Former Uttar Pradesh chief minister Akhilesh Yadav on Saturday met Governor Ram Naik and handed him over a memorandum to over 'deteriorating law and order' situation in the state. Talking to reporters after the meeting, Akhilesh said, "Never ever such heinous crimes against minor children and women were committed in the state. I want the Governor to awake the sleeping government." He said maximum cases of crimes took place on the day when chief minister Yogi Adityanath conducts meeting in Lucknow. Referring to murder of UP Bar Council president Darvesh Yadav, he said, "Murders are taking place in court chambers and jails where firearms are banned. Earlier, Governor used to say that there are Yadav officers across the state (over law and order issue) but now there is not a single superintendent of police or district magistrate of Yadav community in the state. So, I want him to make government awake on the increasing cases of crime." Akhilesh also said false cases are being framed against party leader and MP from Rampur, Azam Khan, to pressurise the party leadership. Recently, first woman chairperson of Bar Council of UP, Darvesh Yadav, was shot dead by another lawyer, Manish Sharma, inside Agra district court premises on June 12. Earlier, murder and rape of minor girls in Aligarh and Hamirpur caused outrage. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

A literary Metro ride on north-south cor.description: LUCKNOW: Until recently, not many young ears in the city were attuned to the nuances of poetry. But thanks to a group of youths, the scene is changing. Passengers travelling from Munshipulia Metro station to CCS Airport were in for a surprise on Saturday evening, when a group of people oraganised an open mic session full of poetry, storytelling and music. Creating a literary atmosphere on board, the open mic event titled Navonmesh was a fourth public event hosted en route the 45-minute ride, organised by nine youngsters. From traditional ghazal to shayari, the youths caught the attention of passengers travelling on the north-south corridor. Anshuman, who performed a poetry titled Musafir, said, “Open mic sessions are becoming a regular feature of the city. Today, the added zing to such event is that it is happening in a Metro and allowing us to entertain the people.” As language was no bar, participants read out their favourite poems in an array of languages, from Hindi, English to even Urdu. Another performer, Anup, who began his poetry with a recital of Saraswati vandana, said, “Such events allow you to make the best use of whatever space is available, and also engage with more new upcoming artists in the crowd.” Lucknow Metro is slowly becoming a hub of literature and art, as over three events have so far been organised on the north-south corridor. From a chess tournament and mushaira to a poster-making competition, these activities seem to be a hit among the commuters. “Sports, literature and arts event add an aesthetic value to our daily monotonous routine and brings joy to the ennui of everyday travel in a Metro,” said Aavantika Bhatt, a commuter. On April 7, a chess competition was organised by LMRC, where children aged between 8 and 14 years participated. On April 28, Lucknow resident Mohammad Siraj Mehdi recited a mushaira on board throwing light on the past traditions of Lucknow and the present tech-savvy world. On May 17, LMRC organised a poster-making competition for schoolchildren from across the city. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lucknow: This IAS donated blood 116 time.description: LUCKNOW: Rajan Shukla was 18 years old when he donated blood for the first time. Since then, the IAS officer has donated blood every three months. Shukla, now 56, holds the record of donating blood 116 times and will be honoured by KGMU on World Blood Donor Day on Friday for it. “I picked this habit from my father. I used to accompany him when he donated blood and realised its significance,” said Shukla, principal secretary, civil defence. His brother Rajarshi (48), a judicial member of consumer court, has donated blood 52 times. “By donating one unit, we save at least four lives. Plasma, red blood cells, white blood cells and platelets are segregated and used,” he said. Prof Tulika Chandra, head, transfusion medicine, KGMU, has donated 15 times. “Regular blood donation is beneficial to donor also as it helps maintain blood viscosity and reduces chances of heart attack,” she said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets.
