Lucknow: Nigerian fakes FB identity, dup.description: Lucknow: A Nigerian and his aide were arrested on Saturday for duping a Lucknow-based woman doctor and social worker of Rs 1 crore. The duo was arrested by UP STF from Charbagh railway station. The woman had lodged a case with cyber police station against them. Hormi KCThe accused were identified as Amra Chukbu Roland of Nigeria and Hormi KC of Manipur.  Amra Chukbu RolandSSP STF Abhishek Singh said the accused had swindled Rs 70 crore from about 100 persons across India. He said that Roland had created a fake Facebook profile in the name Dr Steve George and claimed to be a cardiologist in Britain. “He befriended the woman doctor on Facebook and offered to help in social work. Later, he claimed to have sent her jewellery as gift but it was seized by the custom officials at the airport. Rolland asked the woman to loan her Rs 2.5 lakh to be paid as fine for getting it released. He asked her to deposit the money to the account of Hormi KC in Delhi. Rolland kept seeking money from the woman on various pretexts and this way took Rs 1 crore from her which were deposited in different bank accounts of the miscreant in the past four months,” said SSP STF. The STF were tipped off about the miscreants’ arrival to the city by train and nabbed them as they deboarded at the station. Explaining their modus operandi, STF officials said that Nigerians operating such gangs befriend unemployed northeast Indians as many of them have similar names and then lure them to join the gangs by offering money. Nigerians then use bank accounts of these natives to get the money deposited from the victims. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP: Six IPS officers reshuffled after Yo.description: LUCKNOW: Two days after chief minister Yogi Adityanath expressed his displeasure over the sudden spurt in crime in the state, six IPS officers, including ADG (law and order), were transferred on Thursday. Additional director general law and order Anand Kumar has been made director general prisons and reforms, while ADG Varanasi zone PV Ramashastry is the new ADG law and order. ADG prisons Chandra Prakash is the new ADG rules and manuals. Recently, many videos made by jail inmates went viral on social media, while mobiles and SIM cards were also recovered from some UP jails. The CM was particularly upset with police over the gruesome murder of a child in Aligarh. In a law and order review meeting on Tuesday, Yogi had expressed displeasure over no senior police officer supervising the probe into Aligarh murder. Following which then ADG, law and order, (Agra Zone) Ajay Anand was rushed to the spot. In other transfers, ADG vigilance Braj Bhushan has been made ADG Varanasi zone, while Dipesh Juneja is the new ADG security. Juneja was posted in the same capacity in the UP police promotion and recruitment board. ADG security Vijay Kumar, who was posted as ADG (Security) has now been made the ADG (police promotion and recruitment board). Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lucknow restaurants cash in on the Indo-.description: Come World Cup and excitement is high among cricket lovers. But it's always the India and Pakistan match that has people the most excited. And when it’s the World Cup, the frenzy is at an all-time high. And making the most of this frenzy are the lounges, cafes, and restaurants in the city which are doling out all sops for cricket lovers to enjoy the game at their respective eatery. Most of the cafes and restaurants in Lucknow will be screening the match live on their premises today apart from offering special dishes, drinks and even discounts to lure customers. Given that it’s a Sunday, the buzz is higher among youngsters especially, who want to enjoy the ‘baap’ of all games with all things taken care of. Music and dhols to add to the excitement At Royal Sky, owner Jatin Ahuja is also pumped up about the match. Ahuja is going all out to make the match-watching experience a memorable one for his patrons. “There will be two screens put up showing the match live – one in the air-conditioned restaurant and another one in an open place. We are also making special offers on drinks” says Jatin. “A DJ will be playing songs and music to pump up the energy of the visitors. I am planning to call dhol walas to create that masti wala atmosphere. I plan to celebrate this day in a big way and have the visitors make the most of it,” says Jatin. Dhols will also be in play at the Ttamaasha Bistro. Yogendra Yadav the Manager tells us, “We will be tattooing Indian flag on the hands of our guests at the entrance. There will be arrangements of dhols to boost up the energy of our guests, so they can get an ambience of the match.” SAAT SAAL KA SAATH GOES ONAarti Vaid, Co-Owner of Cappuccino Blast has been screening the World Cup cricket matches at her cafe for the last 7 consecutive years and this year too she plans to screen India versus Pakistan World Cup match at the Aishbagh restaurant. Aarti, while recalling her first live screening at Cappucino Blast says, “The energy was insane. We had a footfall of about 300 people at that time. We had also invited a tattoo artist just to add to the celebrations, and many customers inked themselves the Indian flag.” Adding further she said, “This year is a double celebration as it is Father’s Day too. There will be special cakes along with discounts on beverages and food, not to mention, live screening!” A KEBAB FESTIVAL TO CELEBRATE THE DAYIf you are a cricket fan and a non-vegetarian Karry Sports Café will be a perfect choice for you. Karan Kumar, Owner of Karry Sport Café, who had been providing his customers live view of the matches in the past, says, “We will be organising a kebab festival where we will keep Mughlai food. There will be special offers on combos which our guests can enjoy. There will be special arrangements for the DJ at the café for customers who would want to dance.” SHOW YOUR LOVE FOR YOUR FAVOURITE TEAM!Molecule, another open-air lounge and bar in the city, won’t refrain from sharing the cricket madness. Rajinder Maurya, the Manager, says, “This day of the match we plan to have a lot of exciting stuff. We’ll have people at the drums, live screening of the match, flags all around, tattoo artists and what not. We’re trying to create the feel of the stadium at our very own bar. There will be great offers for cricket lovers and the highlight for the day will be our staff wearing the Indian jerseys to show the love.”  Youngsters enjoying the cricket match at a lounge in the city (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) MUSIC FOR EVERY SHOTZulfiqar Hussain, Operational Consultant of The Drowning Street said, “We will be organising a Food Fest and I will be preparing Chinese and Awadhi food especially for the day. Also, all the drinks will cost only 200 bucks on that day. Every time there will be a great shot from the Indian cricketers, the DJ will be playing music accordingly to cheer up the Lucknowites.” Similar plans are in store for customers at the Farzi Café. Informs Avdesh Upadhayay, the Manager, “We will have a live screening of India versus Pakistan World Cup match along with some spectacular live band performances. We will also provide our customers the fun of a live band performance which will make them enjoy the evening a little more.” ENJOY DRINKS AT A DISCOUNT Shoubhik Sinha, Manager at Mint Lounge will be providing his customers with some great deals this India versus Pakistan World Cup match. “We will be having a live screening of the match along with complimentary welcome drinks for all. Not only this, we shall give a 10% off on each bill with an additional 5% for women on this day,” says Shoubhik. ALL FOR THE LOVE OF AN INDO-PAK MATCHMohammad Aquib, an intermediate student who is planning to spend the day with his friends watching India versus Pakistan match, says, “The match is a perfect excuse for me and my friends to head out and spend our day in a café or a lounge. As I think almost all the cafes in the city will be screening the match, it will be too easy for us to plan as to where to go. I am sure every cricket fan is going to enjoy the match with their friends in a café more than they’ll enjoy at their homes.” Anushka Sharma, a Lucknowite is also planning to watch the most awaited match with her friends in a restaurant or a café. “My friends and I are going to a cafe to enjoy the match. Everytime there will be a great shot by our players, we will be cheering for them. The Indo-Pak match can’t be watched with your parents around with the kind of comments that are passed while watching it.” Shreya Arya, a sophomore at Lucknow University says, “I’m super excited about today’s India versus Pakistan World Cup match. Plus, it’s a double celebration as its Father’s Day too. I plan to go out with my dad to one of the eateries and watch the live screening while enjoying food and some quality time with my dad.” — Saad Abbasi, Viti Goel and Yashi Agarwal Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. Lucknow: Student donates liver to save c.description: LUCKNOW: A father is said to be a son’s first hero. In this heart-warming tale from Madiaon, it is a son who got to wear the hero’s cape. Akash Soni (21) donated a part of his liver to gift his doting dad Vijay Shankar Soni (48) a second life, the successful transplant on Friday aptly taking place two days before Father’s Day. The patient and the donor are expected to be happily reunited at home three weeks from now. Sources at King George’s Medical University (KGMU), where the 14-hour surgery took place, said Vijay Shankar was diagnosed with liver cancer a month ago when he visited the OPD with symptoms such as loss of appetite and chronic upper abdominal pain. The family’s hopes took a severe beating when doctors disqualified Vijay Shankar’s wife and elder son as donors owing to “unfit medical conditions”. Akash, a first-year college student, stepped up to the plate and offered to donate his liver. Luck smiled. Doctors found him to be a good match. A team of experts from KGMU and Max hospital, New Delhi, pulled off the complicated surgery, which began at 5am on Friday and was the third such transplant in the history of KGMU’s gastro-enterology department. First transplant took place in March. The KGMU liver transplant team was led by head of surgical gastro-enterology professor Abhijit Chandra and comprised three gastro-enterologists, Dr Vishal Gupta, Dr Vivek Gupta and Dr Pradeep Joshi; five anaesthetists led by prof GP Singh and Dr Mohammed Parvez; four radiologists and three microbiologists among others. The three-member Max team was headed by Dr Subhash Gupta, a liver transplant surgeon. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lucknow: Two workers choke to death in s.description: LUCKNOW: Two sanitary workers were choked to death while cleaning a sewer near Matiyari crossing in Chinhat on Saturday. The deceased were identified as Shahbuddin, 23, and Raidul, 18. The duo fell unconscious due to poisonous gas in the sewer and slipped to the bottom of the pit and dies of suffocation. Another sanitary worker, Maidul, who was standing on the road and passing on the equipment to Shahbuddin and Raidul sensed some trouble when he stopped getting any response from the duo. He raised an alarm and dialled UP 100. A police team arrived at the spot along with firefighters but by that time Shahbuddin and Raidul had died. It took cops and firefighters two hours to take the bodies. According to the police, Shahbuddin had taken a sub-contract of cleaning the drain from a contractor who works for a government agency. Station house officer, Chinhat, Sachin Kumar Singh said the bodies have been sent for postmortem. Their family members have not lodged any complaint so far, he added. Lucknow: Rajnath pledges to revive defun.description: LUCKNOW: Defence minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday assured the UP government that he would ask the central government to revive the defunct ordnance factory in Shahjahanpur — the biggest cloth factory of the defence ministry. Singh gave the assurance to UP urban development and parliamentary affairs minister Suresh Khanna in Delhi. Speaking to TOI, Khanna said the factory has been staring at closure in the wake of outsourcing of clothing material to the open market. This had led to sharp decline in the production of Army uniform and other clothing accessories in the factory, the minister said. The factory gives employment to over 50,000 persons of Shahjahanpur region, said Khanna, an eight-time MLA from Shahjahanpur. Rajnath told Khanna that he was aware that the factory’s closure could lead to large scale unemployment in the terai belt. Khanna also handed over a memorandum to Rajnath with details of the factory — which was set up during the British period — and remained the largest supplier of clothes in the defence establishment until its decline. Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. \nSpreading cheers among cops\u2019 kids.description: A cultural event Children Summer Carnival was held recently at the Reserve Police Line, Mahanagar. The event was organised by the UP Police Family Welfare Association for the wives of the Uttar Pradesh policemen. The guest of honour at the event was Neelam Singh, a lawyer and the wife of the Director General Police UP. The event exhibited paintings and drawings by children which sought much attention. The event also spread awareness regarding voting among those present.  The highlight of the event was the dance competition where children participated in good numbers. A classical dance reciatl by Unnati Giri won many hearts and a Bhangra dance performance on Punjabi songs was loved by most.  (L-R) Kalanidhi Naithani, Sarvesh Kumar Mishra and Vijay Shankar Agnihotri (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  (L-R) Vikrant Vir (L) and Abhishek Verma and Manju Srivastava (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  (L-R) Dr Anshita Verma (L) & Kalyani Verma and Dr Pravin Ajaz (L) and Anshu (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  Deepti (L) and Saeeda Saira (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) Present at the event was Minakshi Krishna Sima Modi, Dr Pravin Ajaz, Niharika Singh and Shephali Bhagat among others. — Vishnu Jaiswal In Video:Spreading cheers among cops’ kids in LucknowDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lucknow: Lawyer falls in lift duct from.description: LUCKNOW: A 42-year-old lawyer died after falling into the duct of a faulty lift at a private residential apartment in Kaiserbagh on late Friday night. The deceased, Sanjay Sharma, a lawyer practising in civil court was going for some work. He pressed the button of the lift after which the panel indicated the elevator coming up all the way to the fifth floor. Sharma opened the channel in dark and stepped in, but fell into the duct and landed with a thud since the lift had not come up. Other residents rushed on hearing his cream and noise and saw blood in the lift duct and informed police. Police reached the spot after the lift man had opened the duct. Sharma was taken to hospital where he was declared brought dead. Sharma had shifted in the apartment on Kalibari road in September 2018. In her complaint to police, victim’s wife Sunita stated that he was going for some work and had pressed the lift button on the fifth floor to go down. “A little later, the panel showed lift’s arrival and he opened the channel to enter it. As it was dark, Sharma thought that the lift’s platform had come up, but as he stepped in he fell in the duct,” she said. Sharma’s daughter Ananya, a class X student, told TOI that police arrived an hour after call was made. “My father and other residents had met the apartment owner on June 8 to get the lift repaired. Some technicians came to repair it on June 10 and 13, but the problem persisted,” she said. Other residents of the apartment told TOI that the lift had problems in functioning and they had reported it to the owner several times. Rajeev Singh, who resides on sixth floor, said, “I had requested the owners to get the lift changed but they were reluctant. Hence, I shifted to the ground floor.” Kaiserbagh SHO, Ajay Kumar Singh said, “We have received a complaint from the wife of the deceased lawyer, accusing the apartment owners of negligence. We would first get a technical inspection of the lift done and then lodge a case accordingly. A crime scene recreation would also be done in case there is any discrepancy in sequence of events.” TOI tried calling the apartment owners several times but the calls went unanswered. Residents said that the owners also own small shopping malls in Aminabad and Kaiserbagh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .
